definitions.definition: To cover with turf; to create a lawn by laying turfs.
To throw a frisbee well short of its intended target, usually causing it to hit the ground within 10 yards of its release.
To fire from a job or dismiss from a task .
examples: Eight managers were turfed after the merger of the two companies.

definitions.definition: To cancel a project or product .
examples: The company turfed the concept car because the prototype performed poorly.

definitions.definition: To expel , eject , or throw out ; to turf out .
To transfer or attempt to transfer (a patient or case); to eschew or avoid responsibility for.

main_definition: To cover with turf; to create a lawn by laying turfs.
secondary_definitions: ( Ultimate Frisbee ) To throw a frisbee well short of its intended target, usually causing it to hit the ground within 10 yards of its release.
( business ) To fire from a job or dismiss from a task .
( business ) To cancel a project or product .
( informal , transitive ) To expel , eject , or throw out ; to turf out .
( medical slang , transitive ) To transfer or attempt to transfer (a patient or case); to eschew or avoid responsibility for.
